title: typeface of wordmark printed on a label
content:
Hello; could you please help me identifying the typeface used in the wordmark below, thank you.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162616im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20shot%202015-03-13%20at%2021_6026.21.27.png)
author: DumbType

comments.content:
It appears to be Raspoutine, by Dimitri Castrique:  
 [http://www.dafont.com/raspoutine.font?text=Sariel](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162616/http:/www.dafont.com/raspoutine.font?text=Sariel "http://www.dafont.com/raspoutine.font?text=Sariel")
Thank you kthomps5 for your prompt answer. BTW, do you know of a very similar but better, nicer paid-for typeface?

I did find a few similar fonts, by I wouldn’t discount Monsieur Castrique’s work too quickly. Follow the link to his website, and he appears to be rather accomplished (but focused more on photography at the moment).

Two similar faces:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search/Terfens/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162616/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Terfens/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/Terfens/fonts/")  
 [http://www.lucasfonts.com/fonts/sun/sun/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317162616/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/fonts/sun/sun/ "http://www.lucasfonts.com/fonts/sun/sun/")

I think you're right, perhaps I should stick to Castrique's.  
Having said that I do like Sun from Lucas Fonts.  
Thank you again. You have been very helpful.
